creator: sew@de.ibm.com
text:
I check for a substring in a specified string. This check should not be
casesensitive. 

The linke for the check looks like this:

<condition property="PMEandBASEmatch">
  <contains string="${pme.ASV_base}" substring="${asv.driver.check}"
casesensitive="false"/>
</condition>

The message coming up:
file:xxx:2352: Class org.apache.tools.ant.filters.LineContains$Contains doesn't
support the "casesensitive" attribute.

For some strange and exotic reason your <condition> is apparently attempting to 
use oata.filters.LineContains$Contains where it should be using 
oata.taskdefs.condition.Contains .  First three questions:  does your build use 
the LineContains filter, what is in your CLASSPATH environment variable when 
you execute Ant, and can you verify whether the problem still exists with Ant 
1.6.1 or later (dev)?
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
After reboot of the system it works now. Since it is a test system, I do not
know what was wrong with it.
Many thanks for your quick answer.  

Regards,
Brigitte
creator: sew@de.ibm.com
